snippet: The board lacked transparency in its contracting practices and didn’t file timely public financial disclosure reports, according to the inspector general of the Commerce Department.
abstract: Commerce Department releases report finding that board overseeing FirstNet, $7 billion nationwide public-safety communications network, paid no 'systematic attention' to potential conflicts of interest among members; several board members have financial ties to the telecommunications industry.
lead_paragraph: The board lacked transparency in its contracting practices and didn’t file timely public financial disclosure reports, according to the inspector general of the Commerce Department.

headline.main: Board of FirstNet Public-Safety System Is Criticized Over Conflicts
headline.print_headline: Board of Public-Safety Communications Network Is Criticized Over Conflicts
